page.title: 11WOODINGDEAN HOMES AND HOUSES
page.content: Woodingdean has been a residential part of Brighton for about fifty years.The earliest homes were built in the 1930's.These are bungalows,chalets and detached houses to the North.In the 1950's and 60's a large council estate was built to the South and East of the original building.This consists of brick built houses in blocks of four.During the 1970's detached private houses were constructed.All the houses have gardens and the newest ones, garages.Present prices range from Â£23,250 for a 2 bedroom terraced house to Â£77,500 for a detached 4 bedroom one. Very little building is now taking place in the area and as a result, generally, the residents of Woodingdean are older,resulting in falling roles in schools and an increase of pensioners.
